result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin W. Basswood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (<10 Days) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain employment.  Not to terminate employment without agent's prior approval.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

Undergo CGIP and comply with recommendations.

Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Benjamin W. Basswood
Current: 698 Baker Rd, Hudson, WI 54016 United States  (Effective: 05-12-2017)
Prior: N6641 Riverview Dr., Black River Falls, WI 54615 United States
from Rebecca Maki-Wallendar to Judge Becker

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Linehan.  Amended complaint filed with the court.  No victim interests.  Reading of the amended complaint waived.  Defendant plead guilty to Misd. fail to report as repeater and obstructing,as a repeater.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of misdemeanor failure to report to jail, contrary to 946.425(1m)(a) as a repeater and Obstructing, contrary to 946.41(1)  as a repeater.  Joint recommendation for 2 year probation, concurrent with probation now serving.  AODA and recommended treatment.      The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Seek and maintain employment commensurate with his treatment needs.  Undergo CGIP.  

Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 2 years probation, concurrent with probation now serving.  AODA and recommended treatment.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Subject to random drug testing.  Maintain employment. Not to terminate without agent's prior approval.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Undergo CGIP and comply with recommendations.  CC.  DNA sample and surcharge.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Linehan.  Set for plea/sentencing with JA.

Pre-trial conference on March 30, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on April 18, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Court questioned the defendant on his understanding of the waiver of time limits.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived the time limits for holding the preliminary hearing.

records.addlTxt: DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Linehan.  Waive reading of the complaint.  PTC 3/30.  STC 4/18 at 3 pm.

Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Subject to saliva or UA testing upon demand by any law enforcement officer.  Must be at his home except for medical, legal, religious, or child support appointments.  Must not move from N6641 Riverview Dr., Black River Falls, WI  without court's permission.   Must not be gone from N6641 Riverview Dr. for more than 1 hour for normal household errands.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  No counsel present.  $500.00 cash bond requested by the State.  Court advised the charges and possible penalties.  Defendant understood.  AIA set for 2/29/16 at 9 am.
